rules: Rule1: Either region1 has an outbreak or region1 is in a pandemic condition.
Rule2: Provided that organization1 declared an emergency, if the absence of a pandemic condition in region1 implies region1 has a vaccine, then organization1 does not control the spread in region1.
Rule3: Region1 has rising cases or a mutation is detected in region1.
Rule4: If a mutation is detected in region1, then region1 is in a pandemic condition.
Rule5: Under the condition that organization1 activates a protocol, if it is not the case that rising cases in region1 lead to a high infection rate, then hospitals are not overwhelmed in region1.
Rule6: Organization1 activates a protocol or organization1 escalates its response.
Rule7: Whenever organization1 escalates its response, if the absence of rising cases causing a high infection rate holds, then hospitals are not overwhelmed in region1.
Rule8: If organization1 imposes a lockdown in region1, then organization1 restricts movement in region1.
Rule9: Either organization1 imposes a lockdown in region1 or organization1 imposes a travel ban in region1.
Rule10: If organization1 implements surveillance in region1, then region1 does not achieve herd immunity.
Rule11: Organization1 implements surveillance in region1 or organization1 increases testing in region1.

Rule12: Under the condition that organization1 issues an alert, if not increasing testing in region1 leads to no herd immunity in region1 implies no early detection in region1, then organization1 does not perform fact-checking.

Rule13: If organization1 issues a public warning, then provided that not increasing testing in region1 resulting in no herd immunity in region1 means no early detection in region1, organization1 does not do fact-checking.
Rule14: Whenever organization1 coordinates internationally, then either organization1 issues an alert or organization1 issues a public warning.
Rule15: Either organization1 coordinates internationally or organization1 shares data.
Rule16: Provided that organization1 approves a treatment, then organization1 authorizes medication.
Rule17: Under the condition that organization1 imposes a travel ban in region1, then region1 does not have an outbreak.
Rule18: If organization1 fast-tracks approval, then authorization of medication by organization1 implies region1 does not have natural immunity.
Rule19: Organization1 fast-tracks approval or organization1 expedites the process.
Rule20: Provided that organization1 expedites the process, then if organization1 authorizes medication, region1 does not have natural immunity.
Rule21: If organization1 acknowledges the crisis, then organization1 does not downplay the threat.
Rule22: Whenever organization1 takes action, then organization1 acknowledges the crisis.
Rule23: If organization1 forms a task force, then organization1 establishes a command.
Rule24: Provided that organization1 establishes a command, then organization1 takes action.

Rule25: Provided that organization1 has adequate funding, then either organization1 delays its response or activating an emergency fund by organization1 means that if rising cases do not lead to high infection rate, then hospitals are not overwhelmed in region1.
Rule26: Under the condition that organization1 secures resources, then organization1 has adequate funding.
Rule27: Organization1 secures resources or organization1 allocates a budget.
Rule28: Whenever organization1 monitors compliance in region1, then allocation of a budget by organization1 implies adequate funding for organization1.
Rule29: Provided that organization1 enforces measures in region1, then if rising cases in region1 do not cause a high infection rate, then the public does not cooperate in region1.

Rule31: Either organization1 deploys personnel to region1 or organization1 establishes checkpoints in region1.
Rule32: If organization1 implements quarantine in region1, then there is no resistance movement in region1.
Rule33: Provided that organization1 monitors the situation in region1, then organization1 assesses risk in region1.
Rule34: If region1 is in complete isolation, then region1 experiences an economic shutdown.
Rule35: Under the condition that organization1 contains the outbreak in region1, then rising cases in region1 lead to a high infection rate.
Rule36: Either organization1 loses control in region1 or organization1 contains the outbreak in region1.
Rule37: If organization1 performs fact-checking, then misinformation does not spread in region1.
Rule38: Provided that organization1 launches a campaign, then if not having either an alert or a public warning implies no public confusion in region1, then organization1 performs fact-checking.
Rule39: Under the condition that region1 has credible information, then the public does not have trust in region1.
Rule40: Provided that organization1 deploys a team to region1, then if organization1 assesses risk in region1, then restriction of movement by organization1 in region1 implies no outbreak in region1.
Rule41: Either organization1 deploys a team to region1 or organization1 provides equipment to region1.

Rule42: If organization1 provides equipment to region1, then assessment of risk by organization1 in region1 implies that restriction of movement by organization1 in region1 leads to no outbreak in region1.
Rule43: If rising cases in region1 do not cause a high infection rate, then hospitals are overwhelmed in region1.
Rule44: Provided that rising cases in region1 do not lead to a high infection rate, then the public cooperates in region1.
Rule45: If not increasing testing in region1 leads to no herd immunity in region1, then early detection occurs in region1.
Rule46: If organization1 does not issue an alert or organization1 does not issue a public warning, then there is public confusion in region1.
Rule47: Whenever organization1 does not share data such that organization1 issues an alert or a public warning, then region1 engages in global cooperation.
Rule48: Provided that organization1 does not share data leading to an alert or public warning, then region1 does not engage in global cooperation.
Rule49: If organization1 does not establish checkpoints in region1 such that organization1 enforces measures in region1, then a resistance movement exists in region1.
Rule50: Under the condition that organization1 does not provide conflicting guidance or organization1 coordinates messaging to launch a campaign, then the public has trust in region1.
Rule51: Whenever organization1 does not have conflicting guidance or coordination of messaging implies launching a campaign, then region1 has credible information.
Rule52: If not having either an alert or a public warning does not imply no public confusion in region1, then misinformation spreads in region1.
Rule53: If the absence of a pandemic condition in region1 does not imply region1 has a vaccine, then organization1 controls the spread in region1.
Rule54: If organization1 does not declare an emergency, then organization1 denies the crisis.
Rule55: Provided that organization1 does not declare an emergency, then organization1 downplays the threat.

Rule57: If organization1 does not implement quarantine in region1, then region1 is in complete isolation.
